title: The Mill on the Floss - "black locks plaited"

content.question: Maggie submits to having her "abundant black locks plaited" (end of paragraph 2) primarily because she

choices.label: is being true to the religious and intellectual virtues that she embraces in every aspect of her life
is an obedient daughter who sometimes allows her concern for appearance to affect her actions
wants to be beautiful even in a world where ugliness and poverty dominate
wants to humor her mother in this matter

content.answer: wants to humor her mother in this matter

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Explain how a character's own choices, actions, and speech reveal complexities in that character, and explain the function of those complexities.
